sen.j: 菊池氏は、刀伊入寇に戦功のあった藤原北家大宰権帥藤原隆家の孫藤原則隆が肥後国に下向して土着したと自称した。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan proclaimed itself that the family was the descendent of the grandson of the Fujiwara-hokke, Dazai no gon no sochi, Takaie FUJIWARA, who came down to Higo Province and settled himself there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 藤原則隆, 藤原北家大宰権帥藤原隆家の孫→the grandson of the Fujiwara-hokke, Dazai no gon no sochi, Takaie FUJIWARA としました。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan proclaimed itself that the family originated from that FUJIWARA no Noritaka, the grandson of FUJIWARA no Takaie of Fujiwara-hokke, Dazai no gon no sochi, who came down to Higo Province and settled himself there.
sen.cmt: 「藤原則隆」を補いました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan proclaimed itself that the family originated from that FUJIWARA no Noritaka, the grandson of FUJIWARA no Takaie of Fujiwara-hokke, Dazai no gon no sochi, who came down to Higo Province and settled himself there.

sen.j: が、志方正和は公家が残した日記や源氏物語を研究した結果、藤原隆家の下で大宰少弐であった則隆の父藤原政則が、肥後国住人と記述されていることから、政則と則隆の代1070年ころ菊池周辺に土着したとする説を発表、この説が現在まで有力とされている。
sen.e: However, in his study on the posthumous diaries of the nobles and "The Tale of Genji," Masakazu SHIKATA found that Noritaka's father, FUJIWARA no Masanori, who was Dazai no shoni (junior assistant governor of Dazaifu, local government office in Kyushu region) under FUJIWARA no Takaie, was mentioned as a resident of Higo Province, and on this finding, Shikata presented a theory that the family was settled in the vicinity of Kikuchi in around 1070, during the generations of Masanori and Noritaka, and since then, this is accepted as a theory of high credibility.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, in his study on the diaries left by nobles and The Tale of Genji, Masakazu SHIKATA found that Noritaka's father, FUJIWARA no Masanori, who was Dazai no shoni (junior assistant governor of Dazaifu, local government office in Kyushu region) under FUJIWARA no Takaie, was mentioned as a resident of Higo Province, and on this finding, Shikata presented a theory that the family was settled in the vicinity of Kikuchi around 1070, during the generations of Masanori and Noritaka, and since then, this is considered as a theory with high credibility.
sen.cmt: 「公家が残した日記」の部分を修正しました。クォーツを削除しました。in around→around,accepted→considered,of→with と修正しました。
sen.e: However, in his study on the diaries left by nobles and The Tale of Genji, Masakazu SHIKATA found that Noritaka's father, FUJIWARA no Masanori, who was Dazai no shoni (junior assistant governor of Dazaifu, local government office in Kyushu region) under FUJIWARA no Takaie, was mentioned as a resident of Higo Province, and on this finding, Shikata presented a theory that the family was settled in the vicinity of Kikuchi around 1070, during the generations of Masanori and Noritaka, and since then, this is considered as a theory with high credibility.

sen.j: 源平鼎立時代
sen.e: Genpei Teiritsu (Genji-Heike confrontation) era
sen.cmt: 源平鼎立→定訳不明：Genpei Teiritsu (Genji-Heike confrontation) としました。
sen.e: Genpei Teiritsu (the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan confrontation) era
sen.cmt: Genji-Heike→the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan と修正しました。
sen.e: Genpei Teiritsu (the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan confrontation) era

sen.j: 院政時代全国の在地支配層は、こぞって中央の有力者に荘園を寄進してその庇護を受け、院の武者として勢力を拡大しようとした。
sen.e: All the families belonging to the local ruling class in Japan in the Insei period (the period of the government by a retired emperor) tried to extend their influence as a retainer of the Retired Emperor, receiving the protection of some powerful figure in the center in exchange of the donation of their estates
sen.cmt: 院の武者→定訳不明：retainer of the Retired Emperor としました。
sen.e: All the families belonging to the local ruling class in Japan in the Insei period (the period of the government by a retired emperor) tried to extend their influence as warriors of the retired emperors, receiving the protection from those powerful figures in the center by donating them their estates.
sen.cmt: 「武者」をwarrior として修正しました。Retired Emperor→retired emperors と修正しました。文後半、文脈より修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: All the families belonging to the local ruling class in Japan in the Insei period (the period of the government by a retired emperor) tried to extend their influence as warriors of the retired emperors, receiving the protection from those powerful figures in the center by donating them their estates.

sen.j: 4代菊池経宗・5代菊池経直が鳥羽院武者と記録されていることからも、菊池氏がその例に漏れなかったことが推定される。
sen.e: It can be assumed that the Kikuchi clan was not an exceptional based on the record in which the forth head, Tsunemune KIKKUCHI, and the fifth head, Tsunenao KIKUCHI, were registered as a retainer of the government of Retired Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: 鳥羽院武者→定訳不明：retainer of the government of Retired Emperor Toba としました。
sen.e: It can be assumed that the Kikuchi clan was not an exception based on the record in which the fourth head, Tsunemune KIKKUCHI, and the fifth head, Tsunenao KIKUCHI, were registered as the warriors of the Retired Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: exceptional→exception,forth→fourth,a retainer→the warriors と修正しました。government of を削除しました。
sen.e: It can be assumed that the Kikuchi clan was not an exception based on the record in which the fourth head, Tsunemune KIKKUCHI, and the fifth head, Tsunenao KIKUCHI, were registered as the warriors of the Retired Emperor Toba.

sen.j: このころまでに菊池氏一族の中に在地名を名乗る者が現れ、菊池氏一族が肥後国の在地勢力として定着拡散して行ったことが判る。
sen.e: By that time, it was known that some members of the Kikuchi family began to call themselves by the name of local land, and the family gradually consolidated its position and extended its influence as local potential in Higo Province.

By that time, it was known that some members of the Kikuchi family began to call themselves by the local land names, and the family gradually established its position and extended its influence as a local potential in Higo Province.
sen.cmt: the name of local land→the local land names,consolidated→established と修正しました。a を補いました。
sen.e: By that time, it was known that some members of the Kikuchi family began to call themselves by the local land names, and the family gradually established its position and extended its influence as a local potential in Higo Province.

sen.j: 平家台頭後は日宋貿易に熱心だった平清盛が肥後守に就任するなど、平家による肥後国統制が強化される。
sen.e: After the emergence of the Heike (Taira clan), TAIRA no Kiyomori, who was interested in the promotion of the trade between Japan and the Sung Dynasty in China, took the post of the Governor of Higo Province by himself and thus the Heike (Taira clan)'s rule over Higo Province by was strengthened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After the rise of the Taira family, TAIRA no Kiyomori, who was enthusiastic about the trade between Japan and the Sung Dynasty in China took the post of the Governor of Higo Province, thus the Taira family's controlling over Higo Province was strengthened.
sen.cmt: emergence→rise,「平家」を修正しました。interested in→enthusiastic about と修正しました。the promotion of, by himself を削除しました。よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: After the rise of the Taira family, TAIRA no Kiyomori, who was enthusiastic about the trade between Japan and the Sung Dynasty in China took the post of the Governor of Higo Province, thus the Taira family's controlling over Higo Province was strengthened.

sen.j: 菊池氏は平家の家人と化したが、源頼朝が兵を挙げると翌6代菊池隆直は養和の乱を起こして平家に反抗した。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan was once converted into a retainer of the Heike, however, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised an army, the sixth head, Takanao KIKUCHI opened up the Yowa War against the Heike.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan became a retainer of the Taira family, however, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised an army, the following sixth head, Takanao KIKUCHI opened up the Yowa War against the Taira family.
sen.cmt: was once converted into→became,「平家」を修正しました。「翌6代」と修正しました。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan became a retainer of the Taira family, however, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised an army, the following sixth head, Takanao KIKUCHI opened up the Yowa War against the Taira family.

sen.j: 隆直は翌年平貞能追討軍に降伏し、以後、平家の家人として源平合戦に従軍したものの、壇ノ浦の戦いにおよんで源氏清和源氏方に寝返り御家人に名を連ねた。
sen.e: The next year, Takanao surrendered to the army to search and kill lead by TAIRA no Sadayoshi, and he took part in the Genpei War as a retainer of the Heike, but during the Battle of Dannoura, he changed sides to the Seiwa Genji of the Minamoto clan and became its gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo Periods).

The following year, Takanao surrendered the army of TAIRA no Sadayoshi which was for searching and killing him, and he took part in the Genpei War as a retainer of the Taira family, but during the Battle of Dannoura, he changed sides to the Seiwa Genji of the Minamoto clan and became its gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo Periods).
sen.cmt: 「平貞能追討軍」の部分を修正しました。next→following,to を削除、カンマを補いました。「平家」を修正しました。
sen.e: The following year, Takanao surrendered the army of TAIRA no Sadayoshi which was for searching and killing him, and he took part in the Genpei War as a retainer of the Taira family, but during the Battle of Dannoura, he changed sides to the Seiwa Genji of the Minamoto clan and became its gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo Periods).

sen.j: 源平の間を揺れ動いたことで頼朝の疑念を招き、隆直への恩賞は守護に任じられた少弐氏や大友氏・島津氏に遠く及ばず、逆に多くの関東系御家人を本拠地周囲に配置され、その牽制を受けた。
sen.e: His oscillation between the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan invited Yoritomo's distrust, and he was granted a reward far less than those of the Shoni clan, Otomo clan and Shimazu clan, which were, in addition, appointed Shugo (provincial governors), and on the contrary Takanao came to be controlled by the gokenin from Kanto provinces, who were placed around his home base.

His inconstancy between the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan caused Yoritomo's distrust, and he was granted a reward far less than those of the Shoni clan, the Otomo clan and the Shimazu clan, which were appointed Shugo (provincial governors), and on the contrary, Takanao came to be checked by the gokenin from Kanto provinces, who were placed around his home base.
sen.cmt: oscillation→inconstancy,invited→caused,the, カンマを補いました。in addition, を削除しました。controlled→checked と修正しました。
sen.e: His inconstancy between the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan caused Yoritomo's distrust, and he was granted a reward far less than those of the Shoni clan, the Otomo clan and the Shimazu clan, which were appointed Shugo (provincial governors), and on the contrary, Takanao came to be checked by the gokenin from Kanto provinces, who were placed around his home base.

Kamakura Period
Kamakura Period

sen.j: 8代菊池隆能は承久の乱において後鳥羽上皇方に組したため、北条義時によって所領を減じられた。
sen.e: The eighth head, Takayoshi KIKUCHI supported the Retired Emperor Gotoba side in the Jokyu War, his territory was reduced by Yoshitoki HOJO.
The eighth head, Takayoshi KIKUCHI was reduced his territory by Yoshitoki HOJO, since he supported the Retired Emperor Gotoba side in the Jokyu War.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: The eighth head, Takayoshi KIKUCHI was reduced his territory by Yoshitoki HOJO, since he supported the Retired Emperor Gotoba side in the Jokyu War.

sen.j: 乱後、鎌倉幕府は鎮西探題を設置して、西国の押さえとした。
sen.e: After the War, the Kamakura bakufu set up Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu) to control the western region.
After the War, the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) set up Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu) to control the western region.
sen.cmt: 「鎌倉幕府」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: After the War, the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) set up Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu) to control the western region.

sen.j: 10代菊池武房は文永の役・弘安の役に際して、鎌倉幕府から博多に召集され、一族郎党を率いて元 (王朝)軍と戦闘を交え敵を討ち取った。
sen.e: The tenth head, Takefusa KIKUCHI was invited from Hakata to participate in Bunei War and Koan War, and fought against the army of Yuan leading the whole family and defeated the enemy.

The 10th head, Takefusa KIKUCHI was called from the Kamakura bakufu to be Hakata to participate in Bunei War and Koan War, and fought against the army of Yuan leading the whole family and defeated the enemy.
sen.cmt: tenth→10th,invited from→called.「鎌倉幕府から」を補いました。
sen.e: The 10th head, Takefusa KIKUCHI was called from the Kamakura bakufu to be Hakata to participate in Bunei War and Koan War, and fought against the army of Yuan leading the whole family and defeated the enemy.

sen.j: 菊池氏は、伝統的に源平勢力と一定の距離を保ち在地勢力の勇としての意地を見せてきたが、鎌倉幕府に衰えが見られるようになると朝廷とのつながりを深めた。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan, who had maintained a certain distance with both of the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan, demonstrating its presence as a leading local potentials, however, as the Kamakura bakufu's decline became visible, the clan strengthened the relation with the Imperial Court.

The Kikuchi clan, who was originally keeping a certain distance between the powers of Minamoto clan and the Taira clan, showing its spirit as a leading local potentials, however, as the Kamakura bakufu's decline became visible, the clan strengthened the relation with the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The Kikuchi clan, who was originally keeping a certain distance between the powers of Minamoto clan and the Taira clan, showing its spirit as a leading local potentials, however, as the Kamakura bakufu's decline became visible, the clan strengthened the relation with the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 12代菊池武時は後醍醐天皇の綸旨に応じ、阿蘇惟直・少弐貞経・大友貞宗をさそって鎮西探題北条英時を博多に襲ったが、貞経・貞宗の裏切りによって善戦空しく鎮西探題館内で戦死した。
sen.e: The twelfth head, Taketoki KIKUCHI responded to rinji (Imperial command) of Emperor Godaigo, he attacked Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu) of Hidetoki HOJO in Hakata, with Korenori ASO, Sadatsune SHONI and Sadamune Otomo, but he was betrayed by Sadatsune and Sadamune, and died in battle within the premise of Chinzei tandai after fighting bravely.
sen.cmt: 後醍醐天皇の綸旨rinji (Imperial command) of Emperor Godaigo としました。
sen.e: The 12th head, Taketoki KIKUCHI responded to the rinji (Imperial command) of the Emperor Godaigo, he attacked Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu) of Hidetoki HOJO in Hakata, with Korenori ASO, Sadatsune SHONI and Sadamune Otomo, but he was betrayed by Sadatsune and Sadamune, and died in battle within the premise of Chinzei tandai after fighting bravely.
sen.cmt: twelfth→12th と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: The 12th head, Taketoki KIKUCHI responded to the rinji (Imperial command) of the Emperor Godaigo, he attacked Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu) of Hidetoki HOJO in Hakata, with Korenori ASO, Sadatsune SHONI and Sadamune Otomo, but he was betrayed by Sadatsune and Sadamune, and died in battle within the premise of Chinzei tandai after fighting bravely.

sen.j: 武時の意志は嫡男13代菊池武重に引き継がれ、建武の新政成立後、楠正成の推薦もあって肥後国守護に任じられた。
sen.e: Taketoki's will was succeeded by his legitimate son and the thirteenth head, Takeshige KIKUCHI, and Takeshige was appointed Shugo of Higo Province, thanks to Masashige KUSUNOKI's recommendation and others, after the Kenmu Restoration was established.

Taketoki's will was succeeded by his legitimate son, the 13th head Takeshige KIKUCHI, and Takeshige was appointed to Shugo of Higo Province due to Masashige KUSUNOKI's recommendation, after the Kenmu Restoration was established.
sen.cmt: 「嫡男13代」の部分を修正しました。appointed→appointed to,thanks to→due to,パンクチュエーションの修正、and others を削除しました。
sen.e: Taketoki's will was succeeded by his legitimate son, the 13th head Takeshige KIKUCHI, and Takeshige was appointed to Shugo of Higo Province due to Masashige KUSUNOKI's recommendation, after the Kenmu Restoration was established.

sen.j: 武時の武功は高く評価され、その庶子菊池武茂・菊池武澄・菊池武敏等も叙任を受けた。
sen.e: As Taketoki's distinguished service was highly appreciated, his illegitimate sons such as Takeshige KIKUCHI, Takezumi KIKUCHI and Taketoshi KIKUCHI were also awarded with certain positions.
As Taketoki's distinguished service was highly appreciated, his illegitimate sons such as Takeshige KIKUCHI, Takezumi KIKUCHI and Taketoshi KIKUCHI were also awarded with certain positions.
As Taketoki's distinguished service was highly appreciated, his illegitimate sons such as Takeshige KIKUCHI, Takezumi KIKUCHI and Taketoshi KIKUCHI were also awarded with certain positions.

sen.j: 足利尊氏が建武の新政から離脱し反旗を翻すと、武重は後醍醐天皇の近くに仕え日本各地を転戦した。
sen.e: When Takauji ASHIKAGA stepped aside from the Kenmu Restoration and turned against the government, Takeshige, who closely served Emperor Godaigo, went out to the battle fields of all over Japan.
When Takauji ASHIKAGA stepped aside from the Kenmu Restoration and turned against the government, Takeshige, who closely served the Emperor Godaigo, fought numerous battles all over Japan.

sen.j: 武重が関東で戦っているころ、京都を追われた尊氏が九州に逃れ少弐貞経の子の少弐頼尚が尊氏を下関市に迎えに出た隙に、武重の弟菊池武敏は大宰府の貞経を攻めて滅ぼした。
sen.e: While Takeshige was fitting in Kanto region, Takeshige's smaller brother, Taketoshi KIKUCHIT attacked Sadatsune SHONI at Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region) and killed him, while Sadatsune's son, Yorinao SHONI, was in present Shimonoseki City to receive Takauji, who was expelled from Kyoto and sought refuge to Kyushu.

When Takeshige was fitting in Kanto region, Takeshige's younger brother, Taketoshi KIKUCHIT attacked Sadatsune SHONI at Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region) and killed him, while Sadatsune's son, Yorinao SHONI, was in present Shimonoseki City to meet Takauji, who fled from Kyoto and sought refuge in Kyushu.

sen.j: 勢いづいた武敏は阿蘇惟直・秋月種道・蒲池武久・星野家能等を誘って多々良浜の戦いで足利方と戦ったが敗北し、菊池に逃げ帰った。

sen.j: 尊氏が京都に攻め上ると、武敏は再度蜂起して足利方に反抗し、京都を脱出していた武重は帰国して弟武敏とともに足利方の一色頼氏・少弐頼尚を攻めた。

When Takauji invaded Kyoto with his troops, Taketoshi again raised an army against the Ashikaga side, and Takeshige who had escaped from Kyoto, returned back to the clan's home base and fought against Yoriuji ISSHIKI and Yorinao SHONI of the Ashikaga side.

sen.j: 以後、九州も南北朝時代 (日本)の争乱に巻き込まれていくことになる。

sen.j: 途中伊予国に滞在した懐良親王は、宇都宮貞泰を連れて薩摩谷山に上陸、海路肥後国宇土において15代菊池武光に迎えられた。

sen.j: 以後、大宰府に征西府が置かれ九州における公的機関の様を呈していたが、今川了俊が武光を破って九州を平定した。

Afterward, Seiseifu fortress was placed in Dazaifu and functioned as a public institution for a while, but Ryoshun IMAGAWA defeated Takemitsu and gripped the control over Kyushu.

sen.j: 為光に追われた22代菊池能運は有馬氏頼って玉名を経由して島原に逃れ、翌城重岑・隈部運治等と呼応して為光を自刃させた。

sen.j: 吉野の山中にて南朝を開き、京都朝廷(北朝 (日本))と吉野朝廷（南朝）が並立する南北朝時代に後醍醐天皇は、尊良親王や恒良親王らを新田義貞に命じて北陸へ向かわせたほか、懐良親王を征西将軍に任じて九州へ、宗良親王を東国へ、義良親王を陸奥国へと、各地に自分の皇子を送って北朝方に対抗させようとした。
sen.e: In the Period of Northern and Southern Courts, in which the Kyoto Court (Northern Court) and Yoshino Court (Southern Court) existed parallelly, Emperor Godaigo, who set up the Southern Court in the middle of the Mt. Yoshino, not only ordered Yoshisada NITTA to dispatch Imperial Prince Kanenaga and Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi to Hokuriku region and appointed Imperial Prince Korenaga Seisei shogun to dispatch him to Kyushu region, but also dispatched other Imperial Princes of his own to various places such as Imperial Prince Muneyoshi to the eastern Japan, and Imperial Prince Norinaga to Mutsu Province, in order to cope with the Northern Court.

sen.e: Not only in Tono City but also all over Iwate Prefecture many people use the family name 'Kikuchi' written as 菊池 or 菊地, and according to an oral tradition that in addition to the Tono Kikuchi clan, there was a family that came from Ishinomaki City, Miyagi Prefecture, northing upward along the Kitakami-gawa River.

sen.j: 菊池氏滅亡後、肥後国豪族米良氏が菊池能運の子菊池重次の末裔を名乗り江戸時代に交代寄合に列せられ、明治時代になって菊池姓への復帰を許され男爵になっている。

sen.j: 他に庶流として西郷氏があり、征夷大将軍徳川秀忠生母の西郷局、会津藩家老西郷頼母、薩摩藩下級藩士西郷隆盛は菊池氏の出とされる。
sen.e: Another branch line family is the Saigo clan, and it is said that Saigo no tsubone, the Hidetada TOKUGAWA, biological mother of Seiitaishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians"), Yorihaha SAIGO, the chief retainer) of Aizu Domain and Takamori SAIGO, lower ranked feudal retainer of Satsuma Domain, were from the Kikuchi family.
